name: $\Spec \overline{\QQ} \otimes_\QQ \overline{\QQ}$

proofs.connected: The element $\tfrac{1}{2} (1 \otimes 1 + i \otimes i)$ is a non-trivial idempotent.
proofs.finite-dimensional: The map $\QQ \to \overline{\QQ}$ is integral, so is its base change $\overline{\QQ} \to \overline{\QQ} \otimes_\QQ \overline{\QQ}$. Hence $\dim (\overline{\QQ} \otimes_\QQ \overline{\QQ}) = \dim \overline{\QQ} = 0$. See Stacks 00OK$.
proofs.reduced: Any element $x \in \overline{\QQ} \otimes_\QQ \overline{\QQ}$ is contained in $K \otimes_\QQ K \cong K^n$ for some number field $K$ of degree $[K : \QQ] = n$. Since all such $K^n$ are reduced, so is $\overline{\QQ} \otimes_\QQ \overline{\QQ}$.

description: The scheme $\Spec \overline{\QQ} \otimes_\QQ \overline{\QQ}$, where $\overline{\QQ}$ denotes an algebraic closure of $\QQ$.
